meanings.definition: A type of lively, fast-paced music and dance originating in the Dominican Republic.
meanings.sent1: The merengue music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent2: The lively merengue filled the dance floor with energy.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the merengue music got even the shyest guests moving.
meanings.sent4: The merengue rhythm was like a heartbeat pulsing through the room.
meanings.sent5: The merengue beat was infectious, making everyone tap their feet.

meanings.definition: A type of light and fluffy dessert made with egg whites and sugar.
meanings.sent1: The merengue dessert melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent2: The sweet merengue topped the pie perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy merengue on the pie looked like a cloud.
meanings.sent4: The merengue on the cake was as light as air.
meanings.sent5: The merengue dessert was a sugary delight after dinner.

meanings.definition: A style of dance music originating in the Dominican Republic.
meanings.sent1: The merengue music had a catchy beat.
meanings.sent2: People swayed to the rhythm of the merengue.
meanings.sent3: The merengue music made even the wallflowers tap their feet.
meanings.sent4: The merengue melody was like a happy tune playing in the background.
meanings.sent5: The merengue music set the perfect mood for the dance party.
